alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued November 23 at 6:36PM HST until November 25 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND HIGH... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .Observations at the offshore buoys northwest of Hawaii are coming in significantly larger than predicted and appears to have peaked this afternoon. This will translate to the surf peaking along exposed north and west facing shores overnight into Friday morning, which covers the daily peak high tide overnight. Significant beach erosion along with periodic overtopping of coastal roadways and properties in the typical vulnerable locations will be possible during the overnight high cycle. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO 6 AM HST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Surf building to 7 to 10 feet Friday. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island exposed to large northwest swells. * WHEN...From 6 AM Friday to 6 AM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
